title: Restoration Hardware tops 4Q profit forecasts
text:
CORTE MADERA, Calif. (AP) _ Restoration Hardware Holdings Inc. (RH) on Tuesday reported fiscal fourth-quarter earnings of $261,000.
On a per-share basis, the Corte Madera, California-based company said it had net income of 1 cent. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs, were $1.69 per share.
The results topped Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of 11 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $1.56 per share.
The furniture and housewares company posted revenue of $670.3 million in the period, which did not meet Street forecasts. Eight analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $671.5 million.
For the year, the company reported profit of $2.2 million, or 7 cents per share. Revenue was reported as $2.44 billion.
For the current quarter ending in May, Restoration Hardware expects its per-share earnings to range from 95 cents to $1.05.
The company said it expects revenue in the range of $555 million to $565 million for the fiscal first quarter. Analysts surveyed by Zacks had expected revenue of $593.4 million.
Restoration Hardware expects full-year earnings in the range of $5.45 to $6.20 per share, with revenue ranging from $2.53 billion to $2.57 billion.
Restoration Hardware shares have fallen 12 percent since the beginning of the year. In the final minutes of trading on Tuesday, shares hit $75.63, more than doubling in the last 12 months.
